definitions: person who delivers a speech or talks publicly
electronic device that converts electrical signals into audible sound
examples: The keynote speaker captivated the audience with insights
She's a native Spanish speaker fluent in English
Turn up the speakers to hear the music better
He installed new speakers in his car

definitions: either of two soft organs on the chest that produce milk
meat from the front part of a bird
examples: Breast cancer screening saves thousands of lives annually
The baby nursed at her mother's breast
She ordered grilled chicken breast with vegetables
Turkey breast is popular during holiday meals

definitions: act of giving or doing something to help achieve a result
sum of money given to help a cause or organization
examples: Her contribution to the project was invaluable
Everyone made significant contributions to the discussion
Tax-deductible contributions support the charity's mission
The company matched employee contributions dollar for dollar

definitions: flat green structure attached to plant stem for photosynthesis
single sheet of paper in a book or document
examples: Autumn leaves turn brilliant shades of red and gold
The plant grows new leaves every spring
He carefully turned each leaf of the ancient manuscript
Add an extra leaf to extend the dining table

definitions: reciprocal action or influence between people, things, or systems
examples: Social interaction is crucial for child development
The interaction between medications can cause side effects

definitions: shaped covering for the head worn for various purposes
examples: She wore a wide-brimmed hat for sun protection
He tipped his hat politely as greeting

definitions: feeling of uncertainty about the truth or reliability of something
lack of conviction or confidence in someone or something
examples: She expressed doubt about the plan's feasibility
When in doubt, ask for clarification
His behavior raised doubts about his honesty
There's no doubt that she'll succeed

definitions: declaration or assurance that one will do something
indication of future excellence or success
examples: He kept his promise to call every day
Never make promises you cannot keep
The young athlete shows great promise
The technology holds promise for medical breakthroughs

definitions: person trained to care for sick or injured people
person who feeds and cares for a young child
examples: The nurse checked his vital signs every hour
Pediatric nurses require special training and patience
The wet nurse cared for the infant lovingly
She nursed her baby for six months

definitions: basic unit of heredity that transfers characteristics from parent to offspring
examples: Scientists discovered the gene responsible for eye color
Gene therapy offers hope for genetic disorders

definitions: object wrapped in paper or box for transport or delivery
complete set of related items or services offered together
examples: The package arrived damaged from rough handling
She sent a care package to her son
The vacation package includes flights and hotel
Software packages contain multiple programs bundled together

definitions: state of being hard to do, understand, or deal with
particular thing that is hard to accomplish or understand
examples: She completed the task despite its difficulty
The difficulty level increases with each stage
Financial difficulties forced them to sell their home
He encountered difficulties with the new software

definitions: informal or affectionate term for one's father
examples: Daddy reads bedtime stories every night
She ran to her daddy with open arms

definitions: long distinct period of history with particular characteristics
examples: The Victorian era lasted from 1837 to 1901
We're entering a new era of space exploration

definitions: help or support given to someone in need
device or substance that helps make something easier
examples: Foreign aid helps developing countries build infrastructure
She came to his aid when he fell
Hearing aids improve quality of life significantly
Visual aids enhance classroom presentations

definitions: conception or belief about something
small useful item used in sewing or haberdashery
examples: She rejected the notion that success requires sacrifice
The notion of time travel fascinates many people
The sewing shop sells buttons, threads, and other notions
She kept her notions organized in a box

definitions: statement or account that makes something clear or understandable
examples: His explanation of quantum physics was remarkably clear
She demanded an explanation for the delay

definitions: complex where aircraft take off and land with passenger facilities
examples: The international airport handles millions of passengers yearly
Security lines at the airport were unusually long

definitions: series of connected metal rings or links
group of stores or businesses owned by one company
examples: The bicycle chain needs regular maintenance
She wore a gold chain around her neck
The restaurant chain expanded to fifty locations
Supply chain disruptions affected many businesses

definitions: length of water wider than strait joining two larger areas
band of frequencies used for transmitting television or radio
examples: Ships navigate carefully through the narrow channel
The English Channel separates Britain from France
She changed the channel to watch the news
The company launched its own YouTube channel

definitions: drop of clear salty liquid from the eye
hole or split caused by pulling apart
examples: Tears rolled down her cheeks during the movie
Happy tears flowed at the reunion
The tear in his jacket needed mending
Be careful not to tear the delicate fabric

definitions: extensive area of land with a large house
all money and property owned by someone at death
examples: The country estate includes gardens and a lake
They converted the estate into a luxury hotel
The estate was divided equally among three children
Estate planning helps minimize tax obligations

definitions: expression of readiness to do or give something
thing offered as a religious sacrifice or token
examples: She received three job offers after graduation
The seller accepted their offer on the house
The ancient ritual included burnt offerings
They brought offerings to the temple

definitions: person who shows the way to others
book or document giving information or instructions
examples: The mountain guide led them safely to summit
Museum guides provide fascinating historical context
This guide explains how to assemble the furniture
Tourist guides list the best local restaurants

definitions: force or feeling that unites people with shared experiences
certificate of debt issued by government or corporation
examples: The bond between mother and child is unbreakable
Shared experiences create strong bonds
Government bonds are considered safe investments
The company issued bonds to raise capital

definitions: annual celebration of the day someone was born
examples: Her birthday party included family and close friends
He forgot his wife's birthday and felt terrible

definitions: act of going from one place to another over distance
examples: International travel requires valid passport documentation
Travel broadens the mind through new experiences

definitions: process of making something better or the state of being better
examples: The patient showed marked improvement after treatment
Home improvements increased the property value significantly

definitions: path through countryside or wilderness for walking or hiking
mark or series of signs left by passage of someone
examples: The hiking trail winds through beautiful mountain scenery
They followed the trail for five miles
Police followed the trail of evidence carefully
The storm left a trail of destruction

definitions: popular style of clothing, hair, or decoration
particular way of doing something
examples: Fashion trends change rapidly each season
She works in the fashion industry
He completed the task in his usual fashion
They arranged the flowers in artistic fashion

definitions: measurement of something from end to end
amount of time something lasts
examples: The length of the room is twenty feet
Measure the length before cutting the fabric
The length of the movie is two hours
They discussed the length of the contract

definitions: large rectangular piece of fabric used on a bed
thin flat piece of material such as paper or metal
examples: Fresh sheets make the bed more comfortable
She changed the sheets every week
Write your answers on a separate sheet
The roof needs new metal sheets

definitions: money provided for a particular purpose by an organization
examples: Research funding comes from government grants primarily
The startup secured funding from venture capitalists

definitions: responsibility for an accident, mistake, or problem
break in rock layers caused by movement of earth's crust
examples: The accident was clearly the driver's fault
It's not your fault that plans changed
The earthquake occurred along a major fault line
Geologists study fault movements to predict earthquakes

definitions: process of moving or being moved
formal proposal put to a legislature or committee
examples: The gentle motion of waves relaxed her
Security cameras detect motion automatically
The motion to adjourn passed unanimously
She seconded the motion for discussion

definitions: joining or merging of different things or qualities
sequence of numbers or letters used to open a lock
examples: The combination of flavors was perfectly balanced
This drug combination proves highly effective
She forgot the combination to her locker
The safe requires a six-digit combination

definitions: spoken or written account giving details about something
examples: The witness gave a detailed description of events
Product descriptions help customers make informed choices

definitions: atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals falling as white flakes
examples: Heavy snow blocked the mountain roads completely
Children love playing in fresh snow

definitions: activities and processes for promoting and selling products or services
examples: Digital marketing reaches customers through online channels
The marketing campaign increased brand awareness significantly

definitions: container filled with explosive or incendiary material
thing that fails completely, especially in entertainment
examples: The bomb squad safely defused the device
Bombs destroyed much of the city during war
The movie was a bomb at the box office
His joke bombed with the audience

definitions: tissue in the body that contracts to produce movement
physical power or strength
examples: Regular exercise builds muscle mass effectively
She pulled a muscle while running
The company used its financial muscle aggressively
Military muscle enforced the new policy

definitions: upward movement or instance of becoming higher
increase in amount, number, or intensity
examples: The rise of the sun signaled dawn
Smoke rises from the chimney
The rise in prices affected everyone
Her meteoric rise surprised industry observers

definitions: action or process of bringing something into existence
thing that has been made or invented
examples: The creation of new jobs boosted the economy
Artists find joy in the creation process
The chef's latest creation impressed diners
This garden is her proudest creation

definitions: action of paying money for goods, services, or activities
examples: Government spending on education increased this year
Holiday spending typically rises in December

definitions: device for producing musical sounds
tool or device used for precise work or measurement
examples: She plays three different instruments professionally
The orchestra tuned their instruments before performing
Surgical instruments must be properly sterilized
Scientific instruments measure temperature precisely

definitions: large amount of matter with no definite shape
Catholic church service, especially celebrating the Eucharist
examples: A mass of clouds gathered overhead
The mass of evidence proved his innocence
They attend mass every Sunday morning
The priest celebrated mass in Latin

definitions: sound, especially when loud, unpleasant, or disturbing
irregular fluctuations that interfere with a signal
examples: Traffic noise kept them awake at night
The children made too much noise playing
Electronic noise affected the recording quality
Filter out background noise from the data

definitions: messages sent electronically from one computer to another
examples: Check your e-mail for the meeting invitation
She sends dozens of e-mails every day

definitions: series of events that repeat in the same order
vehicle with two or more wheels powered by pedaling
examples: The water cycle includes evaporation and precipitation
Economic cycles affect employment rates
She rides her cycle to work daily
Mountain cycles require sturdy construction

definitions: gesture, action, or sound conveying information or instructions
electrical impulse or radio wave transmitted or received
examples: The referee's signal stopped the game immediately
Traffic signals control the flow of vehicles
Weak signals caused poor reception quality
The satellite transmits signals continuously
